history.content: I know people who take those two plus CS61c. So it's definitely doable.

children.subject: 170 is around the same workload as 70. Weekly problem sets that take 3-8 hours. 188 is really easy. 1 hour a week to do the homework, 3-4 hours each for the 5 projects.

That's an underestimate for the average student. In my experience, 170 has a higher workload than 70, and 188 projects take most students more than 4 hours, probably closer to 8. If the 188 professor only gives out edX homeworks then those only take an hour, but some professors give out written homework which can take 5+ hours. That said, 170+188+61C is a common combination but it's still a lot of work.

I did that combination last semester. In my experience, I found 170 to be more work and more conceptually difficult than 70, and 188 is relatively light in comparison to average CS course workloads and 61B due to edX hw and autograder projects. I would say that 61B is a bit more busy than 188 as 188 focuses on more conceptually material versus large coding assignments in 61B. 188 tests are difficult though and it's really easy to brush the entire class off as everyone claims it's easy, so I would be weary of those tests (found them much more difficult than 170's). Overall 170/188 probably equates to a very similar level of workload as the pair you took last semester.

Agree with the last two anon: I thought 170 (Raghavendra and Garg) was harder, both conceptually and in terms of workload, than 70 (Sahai). (For reference, I got a B+ in the former and a "high A" in the latter.)

CS 188 has a fairly low workload, especially if you're experienced with Python. The tests are no joke though -- they're worth most of your grade (HW and projects are worth very little) and they're pretty tricky.

I would imagine its very doable... that's why I'm taking both of them together. I was just wondering if someone with prior experience might be able to give any reasonable estimation of the workload and conceptual difficulty of the two courses, and perhaps use cs61B and cs70 as comparison.

Took 170, 188 and 162 together last semester. Not the most pleasant experience but definitely doable. Make sure to stay on top of your 170 material and schedule your 162 projects(or whatever that's equivalent) and 188 exams well.

history.content:
I just finished 61B and 70 together and am enrolled in 188 and 170 for fall 2016. I know the two pairs don't necessarily have a relation but I was wondering if people might be able to give a general idea of the workload and conceptual difficult between the 2 pairs of courses.

I found cs70 to be quite difficult conceptually, and 61B very manageable, maybe a bit time intensive during projects.

Any feedback would be much appreciated. Thanks
history.subject: CS188 && CS170 Difficulty vs CS61B && CS70
